timestamp.description: Timestamp of the log entry (ISO 8601 format recommended). Do not fabricate or infer timestamps; use only actual log data.

level.description: Severity level (e.g., INFO, WARN, ERROR). Do not hallucinate severity; use only what is present in the logs.

message.description: The content of the log entry. Do not invent or alter log messages; use only the actual log content.

source.description: Origin of the log (e.g., component, service, filename). Do not guess or hallucinate sources; use only explicit log information.

items.description: Notable pattern or anomaly identified in the logs. Do not infer patterns not present; only describe what is actually observed.

patterns.description: Patterns, trends, or anomalies noticed during log review. Avoid speculation; only document verifiable findings.

cause.description: Potential root cause inferred from the logs. Do not hallucinate causes; base all inferences on actual log evidence.

confidence_score.description: Confidence score (0 to 1) for this root cause. Do not misrepresent confidence; score must reflect evidence strength.

possible_root_causes.description: List of possible root causes for the issue, with confidence scores. Do not fabricate causes or scores; use only what is supported by the logs.

step.description: Suggested action to debug or resolve the identified issue. Do not hallucinate steps; suggestions must be based on log evidence.

confidence_score.description: Confidence score (0 to 1) for this next step. Do not misrepresent confidence; score must reflect evidence strength.

next_steps.description: Recommended next steps based on the log analysis, with confidence scores. Do not fabricate steps or scores; use only what is supported by the logs.

items.description: Additional notes or relevant context found during debugging. Do not hallucinate or invent context; only document what is actually observed.

observations.description: Any extra observations from the debugging process. Avoid speculation; only document verifiable findings.

items.description: A description of a piece of required information that is missing. Do not hallucinate missing information; only list what is truly absent and needed.

missing_information.description: Required information that is missing or needed for better analysis. Do not fabricate gaps; only document actual missing data.
